text: Thomas Edward "Ted" Hibberd (April 22, 1926 – May 10, 2017) was a Canadian professional ice hockey player. He was a member of the Ottawa RCAF Flyers. He won the gold medal in ice hockey for Canada at the 1948 Winter Olympics in St. Moritz.Olympic Games Winner Reference Book In 2001 Hibberd was honoured by the Canadian Forces when it was announced that the 1948 RCAF Flyers were selected as Canada’s greatest military athletes of the 20th century. Hibberd died at his home in Ottawa, Ontario on May 10, 2017 at the age of 91.Thomas Hibberd's Obituary ==References== ==Other websites== *bio Category:1926 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Canadian ice hockey forwards Category:Ice hockey people from Ottawa Category:Olympic gold medalists for Canada
